mnemonic: CARRO = KA-ho - the 'rr' rolls like a motor!
grammar_notes: Masculine. 'RR' in middle is strongly rolled.
cultural_note: Portuguese often say 'carro' even for nice cars - 'automóvel' is formal.

mnemonic: AUTOCARRO = auto-CARRO - a SELF-moving CAR (big one)!
cultural_note: Lisbon's 'autocarros' are part of Carris network - efficient system!

mnemonic: COMBOIO = com-BOY-o - a convoy of train cars!
cultural_note: CP (Comboios de Portugal) runs national trains - scenic routes!
example2_pt: Vou de comboio para o Porto.
example2_en: I'm going to Porto by train.

mnemonic: METRO = MEH-tro - same as English METRO!
grammar_notes: Masculine. Lisbon and Porto have metros.
cultural_note: Lisbon metro has beautiful tile art in stations - worth visiting!

mnemonic: AVIÃO = avi-ÃO - AVIation with nasal ending!
cultural_note: TAP Air Portugal is national airline - 'Transportes Aéreos Portugueses'!

mnemonic: BARCO = BAR-ko - think of a BARK boat!
cultural_note: Cacilhas ferry crosses Tagus - amazing Lisbon views!
'Gira' is Lisbon's bike-sharing system - cycling growing!

mnemonic: A PÉ = 'a pay' - PAY with your feet (walking)!
cultural_note: Portuguese cities are walkable - 'a pé' is common in old towns!
example2_pt: Fico a cinco minutos a pé.

mnemonic: BILHETE = bil-YE-te - your BILL-yet for travel!
grammar_notes: Masculine. For transport or events. 'LH' like 'ly'.
cultural_note: 'Viva Viagem' card is Lisbon's reusable transport ticket!
Look for yellow 'paragem' signs for bus stops in Portugal!

mnemonic: IDA E VOLTA = going AND returning!
cultural_note: 'Ida e volta' tickets are usually cheaper than two 'só ida'!
example1_pt: Um bilhete de ida e volta.
example2_pt: Ida e volta para o Porto.

cultural_note: Use 'só ida' when you don't know return date.
